description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen the capacity of teachers pupils students and the readers of Voima magazine in dealing with the Agenda 2030 goals according to the target 4.7. The project answers to the demand coming from teachers to gain deepening knowledge about sustainable development goals especially 1. to understand the connection between phenomenons 2. to deal with the emotions the subject arises and 3. to find ways to act towards sustainability. The project is implementing Hope and Action -global educ ation model. The implementation is carried out through teaching materials and teacher trainings. As part of the project Voima magazine will publish a series of 17 articles each one will deal with one goal of the Agenda 2030.The critical analysis of the new s and public discussions about sustainable development is in the focal point of the project. Media being the main forum to bring the global south to the awareness of the Finns. Means of the analysis will follow the three step Hope and Action -global educat ion model. The model points out that the best way to learn about sustainability is to combine information examination of emotions and the practise of the ways to influence. The model is being developed during the Biology and Geography teachers unions? (BMO L) previous VGK-project Hope and Action during 2019-20. The main applicant is BMOL. The partners of the project will be The Finnish Peace Committee and Voima magazine. The partnership will strengthen the capacity in different sectors in sustainable develop ment. Through the networks of the partners the project will reach the educators as well as the citizens who read Voima. The actions in a nutshell:28 trainings for subject teachers and other professional educators4 versatile teaching packages focused on the focal points of Finnish development policy17 multimedia articles about the goals of Agenda 2030All the materials that will be produced are publicly spread on the website and the teachers' trainings are free of charge. The project area will contain all of Finland. The trainings will take place mostly online.
